message_1: What is the heat of sublimation for dry ice (solid carbon dioxide) if it requires 25.2 kJ of energy to sublime 1 mole of dry ice at its standard-state conditions?
message_2:
The heat of sublimation for a substance is the amount of energy required to convert one mole of the substance from its solid state to its gaseous state at standard-state conditions without passing through the liquid state.

In this case, we are given that it requires 25.2 kJ of energy to sublime 1 mole of dry ice (solid carbon dioxide) at its standard-state conditions. Therefore, the heat of sublimation for dry ice is 25.2 kJ/mol.
